bill.title: Sales tax; require sales receipts to differentiate between food sales and other sales if tax is reduced on sales of certain food.
bill.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-93, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If The Rate Of Tax Is Reduced Below Seven Percent On Retail Sales Of Food For Human Consumption Not Purchased With Food Stamps But Which Would Be Exempt From Sales Tax If Such Food Were Purchased With Food Stamps, Then The Commissioner Of Revenue Of The Department Of Revenue Shall Promulgate Rules And Regulations Requiring Taxpayers That Make Such Retail Sales Of Food To Provide Receipts, Tickets Or Similar Records Identifying Which Sales Are Of Food And Which Sales Are Not Of Food; And For Related Purposes.
